# Read from stdin
x, y, x1, y1, x2, y2 = [int(x) for x in input().split()]

# Calculate the min distance
min_dist = min(abs(x - x1), abs(x - x2), abs(y - y1), abs(y - y2))

# Print the result
print(min_dist)

import sys
import math

def main():
    x, y, x1, y1, x2, y2 = map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split())
    min_dist = min(math.hypot(x - x1, y - y1), math.hypot(x - x1, y - y2),
                   math.hypot(x - x2, y - y1), math.hypot(x - x2, y - y2))
    print(min_dist)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

import math

# Read input
x, y, x1, y1, x2, y2 = map(int, input().split())

# Find the distances to the sides of the rectangle
dx = min(abs(x-x1), abs(x-x2))
dy = min(abs(y-y1), abs(y-y2))

# Print the minimum distance
print(math.sqrt(dx*dx + dy*dy))
